sources.data_found: Tempest GPU node table: H100 Quad GPU nodes=3 with 4 GPUs each; A100 Quad GPU nodes=2 with 4 GPUs each; A100 Dual GPU nodes=3 with 2 GPUs each; A40 Dual GPU nodes=13 with 2 GPUs each. Also states A100 GPUs are 40GB and H100 GPUs are 80GB.
Tempest overall totals: 26 Nvidia A40 GPUs, 14 Nvidia A100 GPUs, 12 Nvidia H100 GPUs.
Grant template restates Tempest totals (A40=26, A100=14, H100=12) and cluster size (128 nodes).

student_data.notes: Source is MSU Gianforte School of Computing (Computer Science Department) 'General Information' page under 'Enrollment and Graduation Information'. It explicitly lists 'Fall 2024 Enrollment: 469 CS majors, 5 Data Science majors, 30 M.S., 7 Cyber M.S., 26 Ph.D.' I used 469 as undergrad_cs_count (CS majors) and summed masters as grad_cs_count = 30 (M.S.) + 7 (Cyber M.S.) = 37. PhD count taken directly as 26. Page content includes 'Fall 2024' explicitly; no visible 'last updated' date on the page.

gpu_resources.notes: Cluster found with explicit GPU counts/specs: Tempest (MSU RCI). Calculations from node counts: H100: 3 nodes × 4 GPUs/node = 12 (counted as H100 SXM due to 'NVLink interconnect' on quad-GPU nodes; form factor not explicitly stated on source page). A100: (2 quad nodes × 4) + (3 dual nodes × 2) = 8 + 6 = 14, and A100 described as 40GB => a100_40gb_count=14. A40: 13 nodes × 2 GPUs/node = 26. Other listed RCI systems (Hyalite, Snowcrest, Nautilus) did not provide a fixed inventory count of GPUs on public pages, so they are not included in totals.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
